image.alt: Smiling patients at Transcend Orthodontics in a bright modern office

paragraphs.text: At Transcend Orthodontics, Dr. Peter Feibish, Dr. Russell Sandman, Dr. Anna Bonaiuto, and our orthodontic team simply do great work, all the time. Our patients, from children through adolescents and adults, know that we get excellent results, in a timely and affordable manner, while providing compassionate and gentle care.

Because we are able to offer a myriad of orthodontic treatment options, we will develop an individual plan that works with your specific needs and goals, while taking into account your lifestyle and activities. Please call our Bayonne, NJ orthodontic office for more information and to schedule your complimentary consultation. It’s time to make your smile transcendent.

items.title: Flexible Payments
items.text: We accept several insurance plans and offer payment options to fit a variety of budgets.

items.title: Complimentary Exam
items.text: Start with a free initial exam so we can build a personalized plan that fits your life.

items.title: Patient‑Focused Care
items.text: A welcoming, upbeat practice culture where patients feel comfortable and heard.

paragraphs.text: I am beyond grateful to have realized a lifelong dream of being an orthodontist. I cherish the opportunity to support our patients, young and old, to enhance their self-image through improving their smile. I approach each patient interaction with care and joy to ensure an amazing treatment experience. Born and raised in New Jersey, I attended Rutgers University where I earned my Bachelor of Science in Biology. I was an awarded member of Omicron Kappa Upsilon Honors Society at Temple University School of Dentistry, where I graduated with my Doctorate of Dental Medicine. I attended Columbia University School of Dental and Oral Surgery, where I earned my Certificate of Orthodontics and my Master of Science degree in Orthodontics. I remain committed to continuing education and bringing advanced treatments and technology to our practice.

image.alt: Dr. Peter Feibish, orthodontist at Transcend Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: I am excited to provide every patient with a smile that arms them with the confidence to succeed and be their best. I care immensely about providing our patients with a beautiful, healthy smile and bite. Born and raised in New Jersey, I attended Binghamton University where I earned my Bachelor of Science in Biology, and the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine where I graduated with my Doctorate of Dental Medicine. I completed my Master of Science degree in Orthodontics at Columbia University School of Dental and Oral Surgery. I value leadership through action and am committed to giving each patient an efficient, thoughtful treatment experience.

image.alt: Dr. Russell Sandman, orthodontist at Transcend Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Bonaiuto is a board-certified orthodontist who’s intensely committed to high standards of care and always striving for the ultimate aesthetic and functional result. She earned her Doctor of Dental Medicine with honors from UMDNJ (now Rutgers Dental School) and completed her orthodontic residency. Born and raised in Brooklyn, she lives in Hudson County with her family and values time with loved ones. Her friendly, patient-first approach helps make appointments light and comfortable for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Dr. Anna Bonaiuto, orthodontist at Transcend Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Dr. Tina Chung is referenced as a leader of the practice, bringing legacy and experience to our team. Her leadership helps ensure consistent, high-quality care across both Bayonne and Clifton offices. Patients benefit from clinical excellence and a patient-focused culture shaped by Dr. Chung’s experience and standards.

image.alt: Dr. Tina Chung, practice leader at Transcend Orthodontics

Home.title: A Message from Dr. Frank Bogdan

paragraphs.text: Orthodontics, in my opinion, has been for me the greatest profession in the world. I have been pleased to work at a job I love: work has never felt like work. After many years of practice and teaching, I now focus on family and travel, grateful for the relationships formed along the way. My professional background includes a Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey and a Certificate in Orthodontics.

image.alt: Dr. Frank Bogdan, mentor at Transcend Orthodontics

testimonials.author: Melanie Sicat
testimonials.testimonial: “I love Transcend Orthodontics! The staff is amazing! The process of making appointments is incredible. Jessie is incredible! She will always make sure to take care of you as she is just so warm and welcoming! Christie was wonderful when assessing the situation as I had a broken wire today... Dr. Peter Feibish was great when examining my teeth and told me exactly what I need to do to solve the problem. All kindness, no judgement, great direction and always making sure I am good to go.”

testimonials.author: Gillian Sheffler
testimonials.testimonial: “The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Dr Sandman took great care of me, explaining things clearly and realistically with kindness and humor; frequently going the extra mile. Highly recommended!”

testimonials.author: Rania A.
testimonials.testimonial: “Extremely Satisfied! Dr. Feibish and the team at Transcend Orthodontics provided exceptional care. From the friendly staff to the professional service, I felt welcomed and supported throughout my treatment. Highly recommend!”

testimonials.author: Gudrun G.
testimonials.testimonial: “Outstanding Care and Service! The staff at Transcend Orthodontics made me feel right at home. Dr. Sandman was incredibly patient and attentive, ensuring I was comfortable every step of the way. I’m thrilled with my new smile!”

og_meta.description: Transcend Orthodontics in Bayonne & Clifton, NJ. Expert orthodontists offering Invisalign®, lingual braces, retainers, and complimentary consultations.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in an office lobby

paragraphs.text: Our greatest goal is to give you the healthy, straight, beautiful smile that you’ve always wanted. We provide individualized treatment using the latest technology, clear communication, and a supportive team to make your orthodontic journey as comfortable and efficient as possible.

We are a positive, fun space where patients are encouraged to be themselves while achieving ideal oral health and a smile they’ll love. Treatment is tailored to each person’s needs, with clear explanations and compassionate care every step of the way.
We offer a variety of treatment options, including braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> to create confident smiles with convenience and comfort.

Through modern technology, gentle techniques, and flexible scheduling, we make quality orthodontic care achievable for everyone in our community, ensuring each patient leaves with not just a great smile, but also the confidence to share it.

I am excited to provide every patient with a smile that arms them with the confidence to succeed and be their best. I care immensely about providing our patients with a beautiful, healthy smile and bite. Orthodontics gives me a way to be a positive part of so many wonderful people’s lives.

Our aim is to provide each patient with the best orthodontic experience and outcome in as short a timeframe as possible, combining clinical precision with clear communication and respect for every individual.

Born and raised in New Jersey, Dr. Sandman earned a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Binghamton University, then a Doctorate of Dental Medicine from the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine. He completed his Master of Science in Orthodontics at Columbia University School of Dental and Oral Surgery.
While at Penn he served as President of the Orthodontic Society and contributed to curriculum committees, reflecting his longstanding commitment to leadership and excellence in orthodontics.

Dr. Sandman lives in Manhattan with his wife Tamar and daughter Ella. He is passionate about fitness, sports, theater, music, meditation, and art—interests he brings to his practice through thoughtful patient care and leadership.

I am beyond grateful to have realized a lifelong dream of being an orthodontist. I cherish the opportunity to support patients of all ages and approach each appointment with care and joy to ensure an excellent treatment experience.

Dr. Feibish earned a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Rutgers University and his Doctorate of Dental Medicine from Temple University School of Dentistry, where he was an honored member of Omicron Kappa Upsilon. He completed his Certificate of Orthodontics and Master of Science at Columbia University School of Dental and Oral Surgery.

In line with his commitment to serve, Dr. Feibish co-founded a non-profit that supports transformational experiences and leads volunteer initiatives. He maintains a meditation practice and enjoys hot yoga and other community-focused activities.

Dr. Bonaiuto is a board-certified orthodontist committed to high standards of care and to creating aesthetic, functional results. She focuses on building rapport with patients and making appointments approachable and enjoyable.
Dr. Bonaiuto graduated summa cum laude from Fordham University and earned her Doctorate of Dental Medicine with honors from UMDNJ (now Rutgers), where she completed her orthodontic residency.
Born and raised in Brooklyn, Dr. Bonaiuto lives in Hudson County with her family. She enjoys family time, waterfront life, music, and food, and she brings warmth and humor to the patient experience.

Orthodontics has been the greatest profession for me. Over many years I’ve had the honor of helping people achieve healthy, confident smiles and building lasting relationships with patients and colleagues around the world.
After a long career focused on patient care and teaching the next generation of orthodontists, I now enjoy retirement, family time, travel, and golf.

Bachelor of Science in Biology, Mt. St. Mary’s College. Doctorate of Dental Medicine, University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey (now Rutgers University Dental School). Certificate in Orthodontics, University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey.
Professional memberships include the American Association of Orthodontists and the American Dental Association. Dr. Bogdan has also led regional study groups and served his dental alumni community.

paragraphs.text: Start with a complimentary consultation. During your free initial exam we’ll talk about your goals, perform a complete oral exam with any needed X-rays, and outline the treatment options that match your needs and lifestyle.
Bring your medical history and insurance information if available. We’ll review your records, answer your questions, and explain next steps including any financing or payment options.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept several major insurance plans and will file claims electronically when possible to make your visit easy and convenient.
Flexible payment plans are available and our treatment coordinator will help you find an option that fits your budget. Learn more at https://www.transcendortho.com/financial-information/.

To speed your first visit, please complete our new patient form online or bring completed paperwork with you. You can start your appointment request and submit your information using the form link below.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

image.alt: Banner showing orthodontic treatments and smiling patients

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces are the most common choice and are more comfortable today than ever. Made of high‑grade stainless steel, they use small brackets and archwires to gently move teeth into place. You can personalize your braces with colored elastics for a fun, unique smile.

image.alt: Close-up of traditional metal braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Self‑ligating braces use a special clip instead of elastics to hold the archwire, reducing friction and often requiring fewer adjustments. They come in metal, ceramic, or clear brackets and can offer more efficient tooth movement for many patients.

Ceramic braces are made from clear or tooth‑colored materials to blend with your smile. They are a popular option for older teens and adults who want a less noticeable treatment, though they may require a bit more care to avoid staining and are slightly more fragile than metal brackets.

Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners are a nearly invisible, removable option that uses advanced 3D scanning and SmartTrack® material to move teeth precisely. Aligners let you eat and brush normally and typically require periodic checkups while you switch through a series of trays.

image.alt: Set of clear aligners on a hand

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are placed behind the teeth so they’re hidden when you smile. Each appliance is custom‑made to the shape of your teeth, making them a discreet option for professionals, performers, and athletes who prefer an invisible treatment.

image.alt: Illustration of lingual braces fitted behind the teeth

paragraphs.text: Temporary anchorage devices, or TADs, are small titanium anchors placed in the jawbone to provide stable support for certain tooth movements. They can speed treatment and sometimes replace the need for headgear, and are removed once they’re no longer needed.

Diode laser therapy can remove excess gum tissue, improve aesthetics, and expose teeth for ideal bracket placement or TAD insertion. Many procedures can be done with topical anesthetic and minimal discomfort.

image.alt: Diode laser being used in an orthodontic procedure

paragraphs.text: Dentofacial orthopedics focuses on guiding facial growth alongside tooth movement. When needed, it uses appliances and early treatment to correct jaw discrepancies and create better long‑term function and facial balance.

image.alt: Orthodontist reviewing dentofacial growth with a young patient

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in a bright office

paragraphs.text: Using Damon Smile, we don’t just align the teeth; we create beautiful Damon Smiles. We take into account a number of factors when creating your treatment plan. Using Damon Smile, we’re able to deliver a beautiful Damon Smile for a lifetime.
Studies have shown that treatment time with Damon Smile is typically much faster than with conventional braces. Also, far fewer appointments are required during treatment.

image.alt: Happy family portrait in orthodontic office

accordion.header: Since Damon Smile works so quickly, does that mean it is harsh or unsafe?

paragraphs.text: No. What makes Damon Smile work quickly is its use of gentle, more biologically sensible forces than conventional braces. The low-friction nature of the system helps improve tooth position and facial harmony using light-weight, shape-memory wires that guide teeth gently to their ideal position.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation in modern treatment room

accordion.header: Will my teeth hurt after adjustments?

paragraphs.text: While braces of any kind may cause slight discomfort, many patients experience very little discomfort with Damon Smile because of the system’s low-force, low-friction design.

Not anymore. Braces are much smaller than they were just a few years ago, and new materials make them very discreet. Damon Smile braces have a particularly low profile, so many patients forget they’re even wearing them.
People of all ages should be proud of their smile. Adults can be treated quickly and comfortably with Damon Smile, and we focus on delivering high-quality results tailored to adult concerns.

accordion.header: How much does Damon Smile treatment cost?

paragraphs.text: Cost varies by individual needs. At your initial consultation we’ll review your treatment plan and provide a clear estimate. Damon Smile braces are generally comparable in cost to traditional braces.

accordion.header: Does insurance cover Damon Smile treatment?

paragraphs.text: Insurance policies vary. If your plan includes orthodontic benefits, Damon Smile braces are typically covered to the same extent as regular braces. We’ll help you review your coverage.
After your consultation and treatment plan, we’ll sit with you to choose a financial option that works best. We offer flexible monthly plans and can review insurance to maximize benefits.
